means: [人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 斯特赖克 Striker的变体

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含有"打"之意。
means: beat ： 普通用词，含义广泛，指连续打击。游戏、竞赛或战争中作打败解。
strike ： 普通用词，多指急速或突然一次猛击。
hit ： 普通用词，常与strike换用，侧重有目标的猛击，强调用力击中。
thrash ： 侧重指用棍子或鞭子等痛打。

word_mean: 地层中面状构造的产状要素之一。其构造面或地质体的界面与水平面的交线称为走向线，而走向线两端的延伸方向，即为走向。

sentence.Network_en: The strike was called by the Lebanese Forces militia.
sentence.Network_cn: 罢工是黎巴嫩武装民兵召集的。

sentence.Network_en: The strike has taken on overtones of a civil rights campaign.
sentence.Network_cn: 罢工带上了民权运动的意味。

sentence.Network_en: He hoped to strike it rich by investing in ginseng.
sentence.Network_cn: 他希望通过投资人参发大财。

jx.jx_en_mean: hold one's body in a particular position to create an impression

lj.lj_ly: striking a dramatic pose, Antonia announced that she was leaving.

jx.jx_en_mean: do something to help (or hinder) a cause, belief, or principle

lj.lj_ly: just by finishing the race, she hopes to strike a blow for womankind.

jx.jx_en_mean: (Brit. informal)have good luck in a particular matter
(informal)acquire a great deal of money, typically in a sudden or unexpected way
(Brit. informal, dated)used as an expression of surprise, dismay, or alarm
jx.jx_cn_mean: (英，非正式，旧)［表示吃惊、沮丧或惊恐］哎唷

jx.jx_en_mean: (Brit. informal, dated)used to express astonishment or indignation
jx.jx_cn_mean: (英，非正式，旧)［表示惊讶、愤慨］真是见鬼

phrase.cizu_name: strike while the iron is hot

jx.jx_en_mean: make use of an opportunity immediately

lj.lj_ly: he &B{struck back at} critics who claim he is too negative.
lj.lj_ls: 他回击那些说他过于消极的评论家。

jx.jx_en_mean: (of a gas burner) burn from an internal point before the gas has become mixed with air
(Baseball)dismiss someone (or be dismissed) by means of three strikes

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English strīcan 'go, flow' and 'rub lightly', of West Germanic origin; related to German streichen 'to stroke', also to stroke. The sense 'deliver a blow' dates from Middle English

entry.def: When there is a strike, workers stop doing their work for a period of time, usually in order to try to get better pay or conditions for themselves.

example.ex: French air traffic controllers have begun a three-day strike in a dispute over pay...
example.tran: 法国空中交通管制员因为薪资纠纷已开始了为期 3 天的罢工。

example.ex: Staff at the hospital went on strike in protest at the incidents.
example.tran: 医院员工举行罢工，抗议这几起事件。

entry.def: When workers strike, they go on strike.

example.ex: ...their recognition of the workers' right to strike...
example.tran: 他们对工人罢工权的认同

example.ex: They shouldn't be striking for more money...
example.tran: 他们不该为了得到更多的钱而罢工。

entry.def: If you strike someone or something, you deliberately hit them.

example.ex: She took two quick steps forward and struck him across the mouth...
example.tran: 她向前紧走两步，上去扇了他一嘴巴。

example.ex: He struck the ball straight into the hospitality tents...
example.tran: 他将球直接打进迎宾帐篷里。

entry.def: If something that is falling or moving strikes something, it hits it.

example.ex: His head struck the bottom when he dived into the 6ft end of the pool...
example.tran: 他一头扎进 6 英尺深的游泳池时头撞到池底了。

example.ex: One 16-inch shell struck the control tower...
example.tran: 一枚 16 英寸的炮弹击中了指挥塔台。

entry.def: If you strike one thing against another, or if one thing strikes against another, the first thing hits the second thing.

example.ex: Wilde fell and struck his head on the stone floor...
example.tran: 怀尔德摔倒了，头撞在石头地上。

example.ex: My right toe struck against a submerged rock.
example.tran: 我的右脚趾踢到水下的一块石头上了。

entry.def: If something such as an illness or disaster strikes, it suddenly happens.

example.ex: Bank of England officials continued to insist that the pound would soon return to stability but disaster struck...
example.tran: 英格兰银行官员仍然坚持说英镑不久就会恢复稳定，但结果灾难爆发了。

example.ex: Both of them were afflicted with a rare genetic disease, which struck in their thirties...
example.tran: 他们两个都得了一种罕见的遗传病，这种病在他们30 多岁时发作。

entry.def: To strike means to attack someone or something quickly and violently.

example.ex: The attacker struck as she was walking near a housing estate at Monacurra...
example.tran: 她行走到莫纳卡拉的一个居民区附近时遭人攻击。

example.ex: The killer says he will strike again...
example.tran: 凶手称他还会再次下手。

entry.def: A military strike is a military attack, especially an air attack.

example.ex: ...a punitive air strike.
example.tran: 惩罚性空袭

example.ex: ...a nuclear strike.
example.tran: 核武器攻击

entry.tran: 直击(要害);与…起(原则性)冲突
entry.def: If something strikes at the heart or root of something, it attacks or conflicts with the basic elements or principles of that thing.

example.ex: ...a rejection of her core beliefs and values, which strikes at the very heart of her being...
example.tran: 对她的核心信念和价值观的否定，也就否定了她存在的根本

example.ex: The issue strikes at the very foundation of our community.
example.tran: 该问题直指我们社会的根基。

entry.tran: 突然想到，猛地意识到，一下子想起(想法或念头)
entry.def: If an idea or thought strikes you, it suddenly comes into your mind.

example.ex: A thought struck her. Was she jealous of her mother, then?...
example.tran: 她猛地冒出一个念头：那么难道她在嫉妒母亲吗？

example.ex: At this point, it suddenly struck me that I was wasting my time.
example.tran: 在这一刻，我突然意识到自己是在浪费时间。

entry.def: If something strikes you as being a particular thing, it gives you the impression of being that thing.

example.ex: He struck me as a very serious but friendly person...
example.tran: 他让我感觉他是一个十分严肃但友好的人。

example.ex: What struck me as interesting is how much we judge other people by the clothes they wear...
example.tran: 让我觉得很有意思的是我们经常以衣取人。

entry.def: If you are struck by something, you think it is very impressive, noticeable, or interesting.

example.ex: She was struck by his simple, spellbinding eloquence...
example.tran: 她被他那率直、富有鼓动性的口才迷住了。

example.ex: Theresa was struck by her own lack of forethought...
example.tran: 特蕾莎强烈意识到自己事先太欠考虑了。

entry.def: If you strike a deal or a bargain with someone, you come to an agreement with them.

example.ex: They struck a deal with their paper supplier, getting two years of newsprint on credit...
example.tran: 他们同纸张供应商达成协议，可赊购两年的新闻用纸。

example.ex: The two struck a deal in which Rendell took half of what a manager would...
example.tran: 两个人达成协议，伦德尔获得相当于经理所得的一半。

entry.tran: 达到(两全其美);找到(折中的办法)
entry.def: If you strike a balance, you do something that is halfway between two extremes.

example.ex: At times like that you have to strike a balance between sleep and homework.
example.tran: 在这种情形下你得在休息和做作业之间找到一种平衡。

entry.def: If you strike a pose or attitude, you put yourself in a particular position, for example when someone is taking your photograph.

example.ex: She struck a pose, one hand on her hip and the other waving an imaginary cigarette.
example.tran: 她摆了个姿势，一只手叉腰，另一只手夹着一支假想的香烟。

entry.def: If something strikes fear into people, it makes them very frightened or anxious.

example.ex: If there is a single subject guaranteed to strike fear in the hearts of parents, it is drugs.
example.tran: 如果只有一样东西定能让父母感到恐惧，那就是毒品。

entry.tran: 使顿时(看不见或说不出)
entry.def: If you are struck dumb or blind, you suddenly become unable to speak or to see.

example.ex: I was struck dumb by this and had to think it over for a moment...
example.tran: 这让我吃惊得说不出话来，我不得不仔细考虑一会儿。

example.ex: For this revelation he was struck blind by the goddess Hera.
example.tran: 由于揭露此事，他被女神赫拉弄瞎了眼。

entry.def: When a clock strikes, its bells make a sound to indicate what the time is.

example.ex: The clock struck nine...
example.tran: 钟敲了 9 下。

example.ex: Finally, the clock strikes.
example.tran: 最后，钟敲响了。

entry.def: If you strike words from a document or an official record, you remove them.

example.ex: Strike that from the minutes...
example.tran: 从备忘录中将之删去。

example.ex: Her achievements were struck from the record book.
example.tran: 她所取得的成就被从档案中删去了。

entry.def: When you strike a match, you make it produce a flame by moving it quickly against something rough.

example.ex: Robina struck a match and held it to the crumpled newspaper in the grate.
example.tran: 罗比娜划着一根火柴去点壁炉里揉皱的报纸。

entry.def: If someone strikes oil or gold, they discover it in the ground as a result of mining or drilling.

example.ex: Hamilton Oil announced that it had struck oil in the Liverpool Bay area of the Irish Sea.
example.tran: 汉密尔顿石油公司宣布其已在爱尔兰海域的利物浦海湾地区开采出石油。

entry.def: When a coin or medal is struck, it is made.

example.ex: Another medal was specially struck for him.
example.tran: 专门为他铸造了另一枚奖章。

entry.def: If someone has two strikes against them, things cause them to be in a bad situation or at a disadvantage.

example.ex: The Hotel has two strikes against it. One, it's an immense ugly concrete building. Second,  it lies in a rather awkward position...
example.tran: 该旅馆有两个缺点。其一，它是个非常难看的大型混凝土建筑。其二，它位于一个相当偏僻的地段。

example.ex: When I got out I couldn't find any work, and for being an ex-con, that was a strike against me.
example.tran: 我出狱后找不到任何工作，曾经服过刑的身份对我很不利。

entry.def: If you are within striking distance of something, or if something is within striking distance, it is quite near, so it could be reached or achieved quite easily.

example.ex: I believe we are within striking distance of an agreement...
example.tran: 我相信我们即将达成协议。

example.ex: The airport was within striking distance: no more than sixty miles to the west.
example.tran: 机场近在咫尺，西行不到 60 英里即到。

entry.tran: 打开成功(或财富)之门;踏上通往成功(或财富)之路
entry.def: If you strike gold, you find, do, or produce something that brings you a lot of money or success.

example.ex: The company has struck gold with its new holiday development, Center Parcs.
example.tran: 该公司凭借其新开发的“中央公园”度假村而赚了个盆满钵满。

entry.def: If you strike it rich, you make a lot of money, especially in a short time.

example.ex: He hoped to strike it rich by investing in ginseng.
example.tran: 他希望通过投资人参发大财。

means.word_mean: 1. a group's refusal to work in protest against low pay or bad work conditions;

sentences.sentence: "the strike lasted more than a month before it was settled"

means.word_mean: 2. an attack that is intended to seize or inflict damage on or destroy an objective;

sentences.sentence: "the strike was scheduled to begin at dawn"

means.word_mean: 3. a pitch that is in the strike zone and that the batter does not hit;

sentences.sentence: "this pitcher throws more strikes than balls"

means.word_mean: 5. a score in tenpins: knocking down all ten with the first ball;

sentences.sentence: "he finished with three strikes in the tenth frame"
"that song was his first hit and marked the beginning of his career"
"that new Broadway show is a real smasher"

means.word_mean: 1. hit against; come into sudden contact with;

sentences.sentence: "He struck the table with his elbow"

means.word_mean: 2. deliver a sharp blow, as with the hand, fist, or weapon;
3. have an emotional or cognitive impact upon;

sentences.sentence: "This child impressed me as unusually mature"

means.word_mean: 4. make a strategic, offensive, assault against an enemy, opponent, or a target;

sentences.sentence: "We must strike the enemy's oil fields"
"in the fifth inning, the Giants struck, sending three runners home to win the game 5 to 2"
"Just when I entered, the clock struck"

means.word_mean: 6. affect or afflict suddenly, usually adversely;

sentences.sentence: "We were hit by really bad weather"
"He was stricken with cancer when he was still a teenager"

means.word_mean: 7. stop work in order to press demands;

sentences.sentence: "The auto workers are striking for higher wages"
"The employees walked out when their demand for better benefits was not met"

means.word_mean: 8. touch or seem as if touching visually or audibly;
10. produce by manipulating keys or strings of musical instruments, also metaphorically;
11. cause to form between electrodes of an arc lamp;

sentences.sentence: "the archeologists chanced upon an old tomb"
"The hikers finally struck the main path to the lake"

means.word_mean: 13. produce by ignition or a blow;
14. remove by erasing or crossing out;

sentences.sentence: "Please strike this remark from the record"
"The thought struck terror in our minds"

means.word_mean: 16. drive something violently into a location;

sentences.sentence: "he hit his fist on the table"
"she struck her head on the low ceiling"
"She took her seat on the stage"
"We took our seats in the orchestra"
"She took up her position behind the tree"

means.word_mean: 18. form by stamping, punching, or printing;

sentences.sentence: "The icy wind struck through our coats"

means.word_mean: 21. arrive at after reckoning, deliberating, and weighing;

auth_sentence.content: 'Unprecedented' The strike is a really sensitive subject.
auth_sentence.res_content: 'Unprecedented' The strike is a really sensitive subject.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: 'Unprecedented' The strike is a really sensitive subject.

auth_sentence.content: But just what could Iran do to strike back?
auth_sentence.res_content: But just what could Iran do to strike back?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But just what could Iran do to strike back?

auth_sentence.content: This is the second major strike by the guerrillas.
auth_sentence.res_content: This is the second major strike by the guerrillas.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This is the second major strike by the guerrillas.

Sentence.sentence: Although the ingredients may not strike diners as being traditional, they can be found in dishes across Britain.
Um, anything else that strikes you at the moment?
The workers on strike were all fired.
The 500 UK motors workers who had been on strike in High Town for the past 3 three weeks went back to work this morning
How did the 3-week strike in High Town end?

sentences.en: Strike while the iron is hot.
sentences.cn: 趁热打铁。

sentences.en: He struck the table angrily.
sentences.cn: 他气愤地敲了敲桌子。

sentences.en: She struck her opponent a tremendous blow on the jaw.
sentences.cn: 她猛击对手的下巴。

sentences.en: I didn't hear the clock strike.
sentences.cn: 我没有听到报时钟声。

sentences.en: The huge clock of the Customs House strikes the hours.
sentences.cn: 海关的大钟每小时都报时。

means.word_mean: 攻击, 袭击; 侵袭

sentences.en: A hurricane struck the city.
sentences.cn: 飓风袭击了该城市。

sentences.en: A bullet struck him dead.
sentences.cn: 一颗子弹把他击毙了。

sentences.en: As I watched them, an idea struck me.
sentences.cn: 我看着他们时, 产生了一个想法。

sentences.en: It suddenly struck me that we ought to make a new plan.
sentences.cn: 我突然想到, 我们应该制订一个新的方案。

sentences.en: His enthusiasm for study struck his teacher favourably.
sentences.cn: 他勤奋学习的热情给老师留下了良好的印象。

sentences.en: He struck me as being a fool.
sentences.cn: 他给我的印象是一个傻子。

sentences.en: She was gradually known and struck by the audience.
sentences.cn: 她渐渐得到观众的认可和喜爱。

means.word_mean: 采取…的态度；摆出…的姿势

sentences.en: She always liked to strike a noble pose.
sentences.cn: 她总是喜欢摆出一副高贵的样子。

means.word_mean: 罢(工、课等)；在…罢工(或罢课等)；罢工反对(雇主)

sentences.en: The players struck their boss for the payment.
sentences.cn: 球员们为要求老板加薪而罢赛。

sentences.en: The dockers are striking.
sentences.cn: 码头工人正在罢工。

sentences.en: Our troops struck at dawn.
sentences.cn: 我们的部队在黎明时发起了进攻。

sentences.en: My heart struck rapid as I heard someone come in.
sentences.cn: 当我听到有人走进屋子时，我的心怦怦直跳。

sentences.en: His stone face struck cold and strict.
sentences.cn: 他那张毫无表情的面孔给人一种冷冰冰严厉的感觉。

means.word_mean: 突然想到；突然发现(常与 on 或 upon 连用)

sentences.en: I struck on a way of resolving their differences.
sentences.cn: 我突然想出了消除他们之间分歧的方法。

sentences.en: A strike has shut down several car factories.
sentences.cn: 罢工使好几家汽车厂停工。

sentences.en: They made an air strike on the enemy's position.
sentences.cn: 他们对敌军阵地进行空袭。

sentences.en: There was a gold strike here many years ago.
sentences.cn: 许多年以前, 这里突然发现了金矿。

sentences.en: They made a lucky strike.
sentences.cn: 他们走运了。

jushi.english: Davy, we are going to strike.
